results.title: Pic et Pic et Colegram = Eeeny, Meeny, Miney Moe
results.brief_description:
Two small Jewish children in Nazi-occupied France are placed with a sombre family of Protestant farmers in the Cevennes to hide from persecutions. Further viewing: The documentary ‘Weapons of the Spirit’ (# 2048011, Vhs).

Credits: Producer, Pierre Meurisse ; director, Rachel Weinberg ; writer, Rachel Weinberg ; photography; Jean-Jacques Renon ; music, Georghe Zamfir, Janko Nilovic.
Cast: Monique Chaumette, Henri Garcin, Hans Meyer, Laurence Klejman, Ivan Erimitchoi, Francine Berge [narration].

results.title: Pic-nic
results.creator_credit: Film Victoria, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, John Bird, David Atkinson and Stella Babirz
results.brief_description: One of the seven deadly sins, gluttony, is explored when a group of aristocrats picnic together. Not content just to eat the food, the guests turn to their classical environment to devour and eventually turn on themselves. An adventure with appetite. Voices by Vanessa Kortlang, Allannah Hill, Noel Crombie, Stella Babirz.

results.title: Piano lessons
results.creator_credit: Toucan Films, Trevor Haysom and Jonothan Cullinane
results.brief_description: A young boy of thirteen, Craig (Willy Simeon), is less than excited when his birthday present isn’t quite what he’d been expecting - an old out of tune piano. His efforts to learn the piano are thwarted and Craig’s life is not the same when it is realised that the piano has quite a demonic sensibility. The piano drinks, smokes, kills the cat and suffers from several personality disorders that include jealousy…so what is the likelihood that the piano will be excited by Craig’s decision to use an electric piano for his debut stage performance? Cast includes: Ian Watkin, Brenda Kendall, Craig Parker, Raoul MacIntosh, Jessica James. Written by Jonothan Cullinane.

results.title: Piano bomb detective's last case
results.creator_credit: Tiare Tomaszewski, Hecktown Films and Adam Blaiklock
results.brief_description: When the infamous piano bomber strikes again there’s only one man for the job - the Piano Bomb Detective. As a metronome counts down the seconds until the impending explosion, the pressure mounts for our tuxedo-clad hero, who must kit the right note on the piano to diffuse the bomb.

results.title: Piano blues
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Blues Collection = Martin Scorsese presents The Blues a musical journey [DVD]”.
Part of Martin Scorsese’s “The Blues Collection”. An intimate series of interviews with some of the big names in piano blues music in America with director, and fellow pianist, Clint Eastwood. Starting out with Ray Charles and featuring clips and photographs of musicians of the last century, Eastwood’s journey is sure to inspire a new generation as he asks “Who were your influences…?” Whilst guitar seems to take centre stage in modern blues, it could be argued that it was piano that lead to the popularisation of the form with hit makers such as Ray Charles, Fats Domino and Duke Ellington leading the way. Refreshingly includes some footage and interviews with female musicians. Some of the legends seen performing are: Ray Charles, Dr. John, Fats Domino, Prof. Longhair, Nat King Cole, Dave Brubeck, Marcia Ball, Jay McShann, Art Tatum, Big Joe Turner and Duke Ellington among many others.

results.title: Piaf
results.creator_credit: Bill Siegler, CBS, Fox Video, Franco London Film (Paris) and Gary Halvorson
results.brief_description: This feature length filmed Broadway production (made for television) of Pam Gem’s play “Piaf” captures the very essence of the extraordinary and much-loved French singer, Edith Piaf. Jane Lapotaire won a Tony Award for Best Dramatic Actress in her role as Piaf and her portrayal of Piaf’s chaotic and emotion-charged life is inspirational. Lapotaire is ably supported by Zoe Wanamaker as Toine, David Leary as the Emcee/Manager, Judith Ivey as Madeleine and Peter Friedman as “Papa” Leplee. Cast also includes Nicholas Woodeson, Stephen Davies, Lewis Arlt and Robert Christian. Produced on Broadway by Elizabeth I. McCann, Nelle Nugent, the Schubert Organization, Ray Larsen in association with Warner Theatre Productions and directed for the stage by Howard Davies.
